Context:
Program Name: Project Management
Code: B425
Credential: Ontario College Graduate Certificate
Method of Study: Full-time
Duration: 8 months (2 semesters)
Starting Months: January, September
Domestic Tuition: $4,244.00
Location: Online
Program Description: Graduates will be prepared to manage project scope and change, provide goal-setting, project control, project staffing, risk management, utilize project management tools, and perform other functions in careers that incorporate project management or in stand-alone project manager positions. This program is part of the online postgraduate certificate programs offering working professionals flexibility with fully online classes scheduled in the evening and weekends.
Program Availability:
- Fall 2023: Closed
- Winter 2024: Closed
- Spring 2024: Not Available, Not Available
Delivery: Semester 1 (Fall 2023): Online, Semester 1 and 2 (Winter 2024): Online.
Centre: Business
School: Management

Context: The text is about a Project Management Postgraduate program offered by the Centre for Business in the School of Management at the college. Graduates of this program will have demonstrated knowledge, job skills, soft skills, and abilities related to project management and business in general. They will be able to implement project management Institute knowledge areas, adapt projects in response to issues, apply project management practices to the launch of new programs, initiatives, products, services, and events, and participate in a field-based course where they coordinate and execute a real industry project. The technical requirements for this program include a computer running on Windows 10 or Mac OSX with the latest updates and virus protection software, high-speed broadband access, headphones or speaker and microphone, a webcam (may be required for specific courses), and a web browser such as Safari, Firefox, MS Edge, or Google Chrome. Students should apply to B415 if they wish to apply for the full-time in-person program. This program has additional hardware requirements for individual courses. Career options after graduation are not specified in the text.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Project Management Program (Online) (Postgraduate) B425 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
Extracted Information:

1. Career Opportunities for graduates: junior project manager, team leader, project coordinator, project administrator, project analyst.
2. Industry Feedback: Retail Council of Canada, Diane J. Brisebois (president and CEO).
3. George Brown College is a Global Registered Education Provider with the Project Management Institute (PMI).
4. Graduates can apply for PMI's Certified Associate in Project Management (CAPM) or Project Management Professional (PMP) certification after completing any of George Brown College's courses listed on PMI's Registered Education Provider portal.
5. To obtain the PMP certification, requirements include a secondary degree with 5 years project management experience and 7,500 hours leading projects, or a four-year degree with 3 years project management experience and 4,500 hours leading projects. George Brown College's Project Management Program exceeds the required education hours for both options.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Project Management Program (Online) (Postgraduate) B425 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
The B425 Project Management Program at the college offers 35 hours or more of project management education. This program helps students preparing for the Certified Associate in Project Management (CAPM) exam, as its materials are based on PMBOK version 6 and covers tools, techniques, and concepts related to questions on the CAPM exam.

To obtain a CAPM certification, one needs a secondary degree and at least 1,500 hours of project experience or 23 hours of project management education. Completing the B425 Project Management Program will exceed the required 35 hours for education.

In order to graduate from this program, students must complete nine mandatory courses:

Semester 1:
- MGMT 4017 Organizational Behaviour (NONE)
- MGMT 4066 AGILE Project Management (NONE)
- MGMT 4015 Scope and Quality Management (NONE)
- MGMT 4019 Risk Management (NONE)
- MGMT 4085 Schedule and Cost Management (NONE)
- MGMT 4057 Project Planning and Client Management (NONE)

Semester 2:
- MGMT 4037 Project Management Case Studies (Completion of Semester 1)
- MGMT 4080 Business Acumen and Strategy Development (Completion of Semester 1)
- MGMT 4081 [Name unavailable]

The CAPM exam consists of 150 multiple-choice questions. Although the B425 Program is not a preparation course for writing the PMP or CAPM exams, it will assist students due to its PMBOK version 6 based materials.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Project Management Program (Online) (Postgraduate) B425 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
Program Learning Outcomes:
- Manage the scope, cost, timing, and quality of a project, with a focus on project success as defined by stakeholders.
- Align projects to organizational strategic plans and business justification throughout their lifecycle.
- Identify project goals, constraints, deliverables, performance criteria, control needs, and resource requirements in consultation with stakeholders.
- Implement PMI project management knowledge areas, processes, lifecycle phases, and tools to achieve project success.
- Adapt projects in response to internal and external issues.
- Interact professionally with team and stakeholders, respecting differences.
- Utilize technology tools for communication, collaboration, information management, and decision support.
- Implement general business concepts, practices, and tools to facilitate project success.
- Reflect on their role and effectiveness as a leader and follower.
- Apply appropriate legal and ethical standards.
- Adapt project management practices to meet the needs of stakeholders from various sectors.
- Apply project management practices to new programs, initiatives, products, services, and events.
- Appraise the role of project management in organizational change.

Tuition & Fees:
- Domestic Tuition: $4,244.00 (first two semesters)

Financial Assistance:
- Approved for OSAP funding for students who meet eligibility criteria.

Admission Requirements:
- College advanced diploma (three-year), bachelor's degree, or relevant work experience with a resume and references required.
- Applicants with international transcripts without English proficiency test results must test at the college.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Project Management Program (Online) (Postgraduate) B425 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
* Applicants with international transcripts who do not provide English proficiency test results need to take the George Brown College English assessment for consideration.
* Applicants with work experience may also be required to provide English proficiency results and write the George Brown College English admission assessment.
* Some college and university credits may qualify for exemptions, more information can be found in the transfer guide.
* Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges.
* Information sessions are held regularly, sign up for an upcoming session on the website.
* For inquiries about domestic admission requirements, deadlines, or the process, contact the Admissions Office at admissions@georgebrown.ca or visit the Admissions section.
* International students should contact one of the international recruitment representatives by booking a virtual meeting or submitting an inquiry on the International Contact Us page.
* For financial aid and other financial inquiries, contact the Financial Aid Office at FinAid@georgebrown.ca or visit the Financial Aid section.
* To schedule an appointment with an Entry Advisor for advice on program options, visit the website.
* For questions regarding programs at the Centre for Business, contact business@georgebrown.ca or call (416) 415-5000 ext. 2160.
* For inquiries related to the Project Management (B425) program, contact Saifur Rahman, Program Co-ordinator, at mdsaif@georgebrown.ca.

Context: Saifur Rahman is the Program Co-ordinator of the Center for Business at George Brown College. His email address is mdsaifur.rahman@georgebrown.ca. The program is offered out of the School of Management and classes usually take place at St. James Campus, specifically at 200 King St. E. and 290 Adelaide St. E., Toronto, ON, Canada. Campus tours are offered regularly and can be booked online or through a virtual tour. Interested applicants can sign up to receive tailored resources for their application process and learn more about the programs and life at George Brown College by providing their first name, last name, email address, and indicating whether they are domestic or international students along with their country of origin.
